question_text: Which scenario would most likely cause Bluetooth connectivity to degrade?
answer_options: Using a 6 GHz access point on another floor
Pairing a headset near an active microwave oven
Accessing NFC credentials on a smartphone
correct_answer: Pairing a headset near an active microwave oven
explanation: Microwave ovens operate around 2.45 GHz and can severely disrupt Bluetooth communication due to frequency overlap.
